author: Pamela J. Leonard

review: Speedier than my Roku device.  Smoother when navigating also.  The only items I've seen is lack of applications when compared to Roku (I am sure that the library will grow over time) and lack of searching multiple catalogs (apps) for your desired program or movie.  Amazon content is highlighted which would be acceptable since it is their device, but it is much harder to find content on other services without opening said service and searching individually.  This is were I believe Roku truly has an advantage.  When searching for content, Roku will display the results from multiple providers.  This is even though that Roku now seems to highlight M-Go as their primary service - results will still also show OTHER providers.
author: Michael Huggins

review: I like the fact that I have so many movie options, and that the voice feature is so responsive.  I don't like the fact that the voice feature especially is so AMAZON focused.  I know that its an AMAZON product, but it makes it seem dysfunctional when you are on Netflix and say the name of a movie and it may or may not open in Amazon.  It just makes it look broken or defective.  We love you Amazon but seriously?  The box promotes different avenues you have to just deal with it and at least make it work correctly or else have your own box simply dedicated to you and you only.
